dialogues.text: That mother-- Ki-woo jumps up. He grabs the viewing stone from the tabl walks toward the door. Ki-Tek, worried, quickly runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: (scoffs) Oh, no. Here comes the rage machine.  63 64 60.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Why's he acting tough all of a sudden? Is he trying to kill someone? Ki-Tek catches up to Ki-Woo and wrests the stone from his hands. Ki-Woo picks up an umbrella instead. He runs out. Ki-Jung lights up. This is going to be fun. She opens the HIGH-SPEED PHOTOGRAPHY APP on her phone and starts filmin see the following sequence through the app, in slow motio Ki-Woo appears outside the window and starts swinging the umbrella wildly at the Short Man, who sprays urine everyw as he falls. Ki-Tek runs out with a bucket of water. He throws the wat the Short Man but momentarily loses balance and splashes instead. Ki-Jung laughs. This is gold. Chung-Sook has no interest. She continues grilling meat, to finish the food by herself. UNSETTLING MUSIC plays over the wild, primal thrashing of three men. The violent, rage-fueled dance DISSOLVES TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garden is sun-drenched. Da-Song looks up at the sky through a piece of soot-covered glass, an improvised sun- viewer. He has a bow and axe strapped to his back. He pushes the button on his walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: DA-SONG
dialogues.text: (into the radio) The sky is mostly clear. Some clouds visible, but no rain clouds. Over.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: (into the radio) Copy that. I’m here in the kitchen, and Da-Hae has been infected with a serious case of ‘duck lips.’ If she keeps pouting like that she might actually turn into a duck! She looks pissed, over. Dong-Ik giggles as he teases Da-Hae, who looks completel miserable in her camping outfit.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: What’s with the face? Let’s all try to have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: Can’t I just stay home and study with Kevin?

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: I know you hate camping, but it’s Da-Song’s birthday. And you’re his sister. Come on. It won’t be so bad. We’ll build a fire. Sing happy birthday at midnight. Blow out candles under the stars. It’ll be wonderful. 61. Chung-Sook brings up a tent bag and a guitar case from th storage basement. Da-Hae gives up and puts on her large bluetooth headphone shutting out reality. Yon-Kyo takes Chung-Sook to the living room where the thr dogs are. YON-KYO (CONT’D) I’m sure you know all of their names by now. (from left to right) Berry, Junie, Foofoo.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Of course. Berry and Junie only eat Natural Balance Organic. Yon-Kyo emphasizes by pointing at each of the dog’s foods the care basket.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Yes. And Foofoo also needs this -- Kamaboko. Japanese crab cake.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: And don’t hold the leash too short when you're walking Junie. He needs to burn off that energy. It’s easy if you think of him as the canine version of Da-Song. 65  66 62.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Don’t worry! Yon-Kyo is sitting in the driver seat, endlessly rattling instructions until -- The garage door goes all the way up, and the Mercedes sta rolling out. Da-Song pretends to shoot an arrow from the backseat, and Chung-Sook grabs her chest like she was shot. Moments later she’s finally alone. She presses the button Her face gradually immerses in darkness as the shutter go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chung-Sook is taking a peaceful nap on the large sofa. We her soft breathing. Slanted late afternoon rays wrap her warmly. She slowly wakes up and wipes her drool. When she sits up see Ki-Tek sleeping behind her. Chung-Sook looks out at t garden where -- Ki-Woo is lying in the grass with the three dogs. Looking the sky. We notice a YELLOW JOURNAL clutched in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: What are you doing out there? Come inside. Ki-Woo takes a deep breath as he gazes up at the sky. He’ never been more relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: You should try it. It’s nice to be able to see the sky from your own home. He picks himself up and walks into the living room. He stretches his arms as he walks over to the kitchen. KI-WOO (CONT’D) Water, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Sure. Ki-Woo gets a few bottles of Evian from the fridge. He gi one to Chung-Sook before heading up the stairs.  67 68 69 70 63. A groggy Ki-Tek gets up from the sofa and trudges over to cabinet in the corner. A variety of whiskeys are on displ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Jung is taking a bubble bath. She picks up the remote changes the channel on the wall-mounted TV when -- A KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You want a water?

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: Read my mind. Thanks, brodie. The door opens a crack, and Ki-Woo rolls a bottle toward Jung. He then continues on to -- INT. MANSION - DA-HAE’S ROOM - EVENING 68 Ki-Woo throws himself on Da-Hae’s bed. He reaches into th space between the bed and the wall and finds a PRETTY WOO BOX hidden there. Da-Hae’s box of secrets. It has a small combination lock on the front. Ki-Woo unlocks the box and puts in the yellow journal he reading. He then takes out ANOTHER YELLOW JOURNAL and ope it. Pages filled with Da-Hae’s small, thoughtful handwriting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Tek sits with a white towel across his lap, sweating i in the steam-filled room. He guzzles down a cold bottle o Evian. Refreshing. He turns the HOURGLASS upside down. The sound of myriad sand grains rolling down the glass tu into -- THE SOUND OF RAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large coffee table is filled with various whiskey bot and gourmet snacks. The four family members are comfortab sprawled across the couch and floor. It’s like they own t place. They sip whiskey and watch rain falling outside the windo  64.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: This is classy. Sipping whiskey on a rainy day. Enjoying the view. Ki-Tek takes several bottles and pours a little of each i his tumbler.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? Why are you mixing all the booze?

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: This way Mr. Park won’t notice. It'll be too obvious if we drink from only one bottle.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Nice to see you use that brain for once. Berry comes over to Chung-Sook wagging her tail, but Chun kicks her away. Chung-Sook is already drunk. Her face is bright red.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: But you always get shitfaced when you mix your drinks, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: (smiles) Ki-Jung, that’s no way to talk to your father. “Shitfaced.” No. Not you too.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Let me pour you a shot, Father. Ki-Woo tries to lighten the mood. He looks out the window he pours a shot with both hands. KI-WOoO (CONT’D) It’s probably raining at the campsite too. They must be having a magical time. Da-Hae and her family. Raindrops pattering the tent. Playing the guitar...

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: By the way. What’s that yellow notebook you've been carrying?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: This?  65. Ki-Woo picks up the yellow journal. KI-wWoO (CONT’D) Da-Hae’s diary.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. Why are you reading that?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: I just want to understand her on a deeper level.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: Disgusting. You two going out or something?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: (nods ) It’s serious. She likes me too. I’m going to officially ask her out when she goes to college. For real. They all stare at Ki-Woo. He must be shitting them. But h not. Ki-Tek slaps Ki-Woo’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: That’s my boy! That means this is your future wife’s house! The Parks will be your in-laws!

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: (laughs) I guess that’s true. Chung-Sook joins the laughter.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: You mean I’m fucking washing dishes for my future in-laws?

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Hilarious! You’re washing your future in-law’s tighty-whities! Your daughter-in-law’s school socks! Ki-Tek pretends to wash a sock, laughing hysterically, wh suddenly feels Chung-Sook’s murderous glare. He slowly st Chung-Sook downs her whiskey and turns serious. She calml turns to Ki-Woo.  66.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: I like that girl. She’s nice. Pretty. But not full of herself.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Well, as long as we’re getting ahead of ourselves -- If you think about it, nowadays people barely see their in-laws anyway. How many times do you think families see each other after their kids get married?

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: (scoffs) Crazy fuck.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: You hear about people hiring actors to stand in for their parents at weddings. We’1ll do the same thing. A lot of TV extras do that kind of work. Ki-Woo points at Ki-Jung. KI-WOoO (CONT’D) She did too. Got paid to be one of the bride’s guests. She went to a bunch of weddings last year.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: I even caught a bouquet once. First time I ever saw the bitch. They pay ten bucks extra for the bouquet.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: (laughs) That’s how you became such a good actress! Good times continue as whiskey flows. Jokes and laughter abound.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Sure the acting was good, but I was surprised that the family was so easy to trick.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Especially the missus. Not the sharpest knife in the drawer. I guess we should be thankful for that--  67.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Yes, she’s so innocent. And kind. A rich person who’s also kindhearted. Chung-Sook stops mid-sip and stares at Ki-Tek.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Not “also kindhearted.” She’s kindhearted because she’s rich. You get it? Ki-Tek doesn’t. Chung-Sook looks around -- CHUNG-SOOK (CONT’D) If I had all this, my heart would be overflowing with kindness! Chung-Sook’s voice grows. She gulps downs another glass.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: That’s true. Your mother has a point. Rich people are more naive. They don’t have a bitter bone in them. And the kids are happier. No wiseasses.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: It’s the money! Money cures all the little wiseasses! Ki-Jung slowly grows irritated as her parents go on and o about rich people. She tosses back her whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Ki-Woo. That guy. What was his name? Yun? The old driver. KI-WwoO Yes. Mr. Yun.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: He’s probably doing fine, right? I’m sure he got a new job.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Of course. He’s young. Healthy. Plenty of opportunities.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m sure he got an even better job. Ki-Jung SLAMS down her glass and yells at her family --  68.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: What the hell’s wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: Fuck rich people! Just worry about your own goddamn family! Ki-Jung looks like she’s about to cry. We’ve never seen h like this before. Vulnerable. Like a hurt child.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad, please. Stop worrying about other people. Look at me. Us. Your son and daughter. We’re right here! Almost at the exact moment as Ki-Jung’s soulful outburst, a timed effect, LIGHTNING AND THUNDER strike outside the window. Followed by heavy rain. Ki-Tek looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: (laughing) Did you see that! Right on cue!

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: (imitating Ki-Jung) “Dad, we're right here!” POW! Thunder and lightning! Awesome. Ki-Woo tries to console Ki-Jung. He brushes her hair and in a brotherly voice. KI-WoO (CONT’D) Come on now, Jessica. Let’s drink. Cheers! Ki-Woo clinks his glass against Ki-Jung’s. KI-WOoO (CONT’D) You know, Ki-Jung, when I saw you upstairs in the bathroom-- You looked so--

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: What? I looked so what?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: You just looked so natural in that bathtub. This house. It suits you. You’re not like us.  69.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: (smiles) Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: (to Ki-Tek) It’s true, Dad. She was in the tub watching TV, taking a fancy bubble bath, and it just felt like she belonged here.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Is that right? Ki-Woo becomes more animated at Ki-Tek’s exaggerated reac He opens his arms wide and looks around at the living roo

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Imagine for a second that this is our house. Let’s say we live here. Which room would you like to have? Out of all the beautiful rooms designed by the great Namgoong Hyunja, which one would you want to be yours?

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Buy me the fucking house first and I’1l think about it.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: We're ‘living’ here right now, aren’t we? We’re here in the living room, drinking and having a good time, just like we would if this was our place.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: That’s true. We ARE currently living here. For all intents and purposes.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: This IS our house right now. (burps) Nice and cozy. Chung-Sook, face bulging red, flashes a dirty grin.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: You're cozy, huh? That’s real nice. What if Park comes back right now? (to Ki-Jung) He would skitter away like a little cockroach.  70. Chung-Sook laughs loudly at her own joke. Ki-Tek is quiet CHUNG-SOOK (CONT’D) (snickering) You kids know what I’m talking about, right? Our apartment. How when we turn on the kitchen lights, the roaches all run away and disappear under the cabinets. He would be exactly like that! Ki-Tek stares hard at Chung-Sook, who continues to howl. Tek’s eyes are red. Hostile. This is a different Ki-Tek.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: (mumbling) Fucking bitch. You’ve gone too far this time. Chung-Sook is silent. KI-TEK (CONT’D) What? I’m a cockroach? CRASH! Ki-Tek sweeps the table and knocks over the bottle plates. Ki-Woo and Ki-Jung are stunned. Chung-Sook is absolutely still. She glowers at Ki-Tek, wh unlike before doesn’t back down. He stares right back, te growing, when -- His face starts cracking. He begins to snicker. Chung-Sook does too. They both burst into laughter. KI-TEK (CONT’D) I got you! I totally got you! The two continue to laugh their asses off. Ki-Tek seems especially pleased with his performance. He slaps Ki-Woo the shoulder. KI-TEK (CONT’D) How was that, Spielberg? Pretty realistic right? You like my acting now?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Wow, Dad! You totally got me. Ki-Jung laughs, relieved.  71.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: (to Ki-Tek) Shit. You’re going to clean this up, right?

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: (laughing) I didn’t believe him for one second.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Really? I thought he was really going to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: He could never do that. Your father hasn’t a single backbone in his body. The epitome of a spineless mo-- They are all laughing uproariously when -- The DOORBELL rings loudly throughout the house. They all freeze and look at each other. Who the hell coul that be? The doorbell continues to ring.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Who could it be at this time?

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: What do you think it is? Chung-Sook scurries over to the gate monitor. She sees -- A familiar round face filling the screen. It’s MUN-KWANG. She’s standing in the rain dressed in all black.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: What the--

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Why is she here?

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: It’s her, right? The old housekeeper.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: (nods ) Why do you think she’s here? Mun-Kwang presses the doorbell again and again. It rings loudly throughout the neighborhood. This could go on for while.  72.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: What's she doing? Why doesn’t she just leave?

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: It’s so loud. She could go on all night--

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) Hold on. I’m supposed to be here. I can answer. Before Ki-Woo can stop her, Chung-Sook presses the ‘speak button. Mun-Kwang’ CHUNG-SOOK (CONT’D) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG, (SPEAKER)
dialogues.text: Hi, how are you? I’m-- Mrs. Park isn’t in, right? s speech is slightly slurred. She’s had a drink or two herself. Mun-Kwang guard. Mun-Kwang

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG, (SPEAKER)
dialogues.text: I used to work here. For ma--ny many years. The monitor you’re looking at. There’s a picture above it, right? Berry, Junie, Foofoo -- from left to right.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: That’s all fine, but how can I help you? It’s very late.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG, (SPEAKER)
dialogues.text: You're my replacement, aren’t you! laughs. Sad, drunk laughter. Chung-Sook remains on suddenly turns serious.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG, (SPEAKER)
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry to bother you at this hour. There’s something in the basement that I left behind, and I was wondering if I could pick it up. I was fired without any notice so I didn’t have time to gather all my things.  71 72 73. Chung-Sook looks at Ki-Woo. What do we do? Ki-Woo has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: This wasn’t in our plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chung-Sook opens the door to reveal Mun-Kwang standing in rain. She looks grotesque with one eye heavily swollen. H face is eerily and intermittently illuminated by the moti sensor light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mun-Kwang drips water as she walks over to the kitchen. T living room is not fully visible from her vantage point. Ki-Tek, Ki-Woo, and Ki-Jung remain in the dark around the coffee table, listening to Chung-Sook and Mun-Kwang’s conversation.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: I’m sorry for the intrusion. Thank you so much for letting me in. She looks over at the kitchen sink. MUN-KWANG (CONT’D) The faucet drips if you turn it that way. Mun-Kwang continues to drone on deliriously. We don’t kno she’s just drunk or crazy.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: The faucet’s fine. What do you need to pick up?

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Would you like to come down with me? Mun-Kwang flashes a creepy grin as she points to the stai descending into the dark storage basement. Chung-Sook is spooked. She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: No thanks. Just hurry up and get what you need.  73 74 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- A DROP OF WATER precariously dangling from th kitchen faucet. It’s been a while since Mun-Kwang went down to the storag room. Chung-Sook starts getting worried. She gets up from chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nervous Chung-Sook walks down the narrow staircase and into the darkness. She hears a strange MOAN coming from i and soon discovers -- Mun-Kwang_ levitating horizontally in the air! We realize she actually has her feet set against the wall and is pus the jar cabinet with her hands. The glass jars rattle as shoves with all her might. Chung-Sook is confused.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Can you give me a hand? Help me push!

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: (tearful) He’s going to die! Please!

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: What's going on--

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Just help me first! Chung-Sook has no idea what’s going on but starts pushing Mun-Kwang. We see Ki-Woo, Ki-Jung, and Ki-Tek peeking from the stair Chung-Sook sees something on the ground as she’s pushing.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Wait. Maybe this is the problem. Chung-Sook pulls a bundle of wires stuck under the cabine soon as she does --  75 75. The cabinet smoothly rolls to the side pretty much on its as if it’s set on rails. It moves out of view to reveal, Chung-Sook’s great astonishment -- A DARK STEEL DOOR hidden behind it. Mun-Kwang opens the door and hurries inside. Chung-Sook shakes off her shock and follows Mun-Kwang dow dark staircase.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Babe! Babe! We get glimpses of the dark underground bunker as Mun-Kwa waves around the flashlight on her cell phone -- low ceil gray walls, a small passageway... Chung-Sook covers her nose at the awful smell. MUN-KWANG (CONT’D) Kun-Sae! Mun-Kwang’s flashlight finally finds -- A PALE, SEVERELY MALNOURISHED FACE. This is KUN-SAE, 45, Kwang’s husband. He looks up from his cot, woken up by th sound. He blinks his large eyes. Chung-Sook looks horrified.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: Stop yelling. I’m okay... Mun-Kwang immediately shoves a BABY BOTTLE in his mouth a starts feeding him. It’s filled with some kind of gruel.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: No, you're not. You’re not okay! (weeping) Why are you in the dark? Why did you turn off the lights?

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: We have to conserve energy. It all comes out of Mr. Park’s pocket. Kun-Sae turns on the light and is startled to see -- Chung-Sook standing in front of him.  76. He springs from his bed, but Mun-Kwang pushes him back do

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: It’s fine. We’re okay. Mun-Kwang points at Chung-Sook. MUN-KWANG (CONT’D) She’s a friend. She helped me get in here. It was the damn wires. They were stuck under the cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: No wonder. (laughs weakly) I tried everything but I couldn’t get it to open. I couldn’t go up to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: (sobbing) How many days have you gone without food? I’m so sorry, babe! Chung-Sook is at a loss. Ki-Woo, Ki-Jung, and Ki-Tek have followed Chung-Sook and Kwang down and are eavesdropping from the staircase. They stunned.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: What are you people up to? Why are you--

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: I know how this looks. You must think we’re crazy. But please, Chung-Sook. Have some pity. Us domestic workers, we're sisters--

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: (surprised) How the hell do you know my name?

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Da-Song and I still text from time to time. I came here because I knew the family would be ona camping trip. I wanted to talk to you alone. Chung-Sook can’t believe her ears. Surprise turns to ange MUN-KWANG (CONT’D) Don’t worry, sis. No one knows I’m here.  77. Mun-Kwang removes a pair of wire cutters from her pocket. MUN-KWANG (CONT’D) I cut the wires on the surveillance camera on my way in. That’s good, right? Huh, big sis?

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Wait. Hold on. Aren’t you older than me?

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: I was born in 74. Year of the tiger. My name is Mun-Kwang. Chung-Sook is speechless. Mun-Kwang points to Kun-Sae. MUN-KWANG (CONT’D) This is my husband Oh Kun-Sae. Kun-Sae smiles innocently as he continues to suck on the bottle. Chung-Sook regards the scene with disbelief. Mun-Kwang takes out a banana from her pocket. feeds it to Kun-Sae.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: So the whole time you were working here, you were smuggling food down from the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: No! Everything he ate came from my pocket. From the money I made here. I never stole anything!

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Sure. And how long has he been down here? Your husband.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Let’s see-- About four years?

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: Four years, three months, and seventeen days to be exact! Kun-Sae laughs. She peels it and  78.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: That’s right. It’s already June. He started living here after Mr. Namgoong moved out four years ago. Before Da-Song’s family moved in. Chung-Sook looks around the room. It has a toilet, sink, fridge, an old-fashioned TV set... Enough amenities to su underground. Mun-Kwang continues to speak, blinking her swollen eyes. MUN-KWANG (CONT’D) A lot of these rich people, they build bunkers and secret rooms in their homes. You know, in case the North Koreans invade, or in case creditors come knocking on their doors. Maybe Mr. Namgoong felt embarrassed about building such a room. He didn’t mention it to the Parks when he sold the house.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Nobody in the house knew about the room. Except me.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Some balls you got. Well, now I know too! And I know what I’m going to do! Chung-Sook takes out her phone. Mun-Kwang CHUNG-SOOK (CONT’D) Call the fucking cops. drops to her knees and starts begging.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: No! Please sis! (sobs) We’re all in the same boat, aren’t we? We all need a little help to get by.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: I’m not your fucking sister, bitch. And I don’t need nobody's help.  Mun-Kwang 79.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Well, I do! I don’t have a house. I don’t have money. All I have is a mountain of debt.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do about it?

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: He’s been down here for four years, and the loan sharks still won’t let go. They’re obsessed. They say they’re going to kill him!

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: You borrowed from loan sharks? nods.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: It’s all my fault. (laughs, embarrassed) I started a cake shop -- Taiwanese Castella -- and it completely bankrupted us. Kun-Sae laughs again. A nervous habit. When Ki-Tek hears the word ‘Castella,’ his face crowds wi emotion. Mun-Kwang He knows the shame. hands Chung-Sook an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Please, take this.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: It’s not much, I know. But I can send you money every month. All I ask is that you come down here every other day and leave him something to eat. Actually no. Once a week is fine. There’s a little fridge down here so--

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? You people are unbelievable-- Get away from me. Chung-Sook lifts her phone.  80. CHUNG-SOOK (CONT’D) I’m going to call the cops. Ki-Tek and the kids look worried. That wouldn’t be good f them either. Ki-Tek is awkwardly leaning over, listening the conversation, when -- His foot slips and he falls down the stairs! He is unable control his large body and takes down Ki-Jung and Ki-Woo him. Ki-Jung screams. Chung-Sook is startled when she sees the family spilling the stairs. Mun-Kwang is even more confused. It’s Kevin, Jessica, and Kim! Why are they here?

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Honey, who are all these people?

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Ms. Jessica? Mr. Kim... What’s everyone doing down here? Mun-Kwang is speechless for a moment before the pieces sl come together in her head. She takes out her cell phone. As Ki-Tek scrambles to get up, he accidentally steps on K Woo’s foot.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Ow! Dad, my foot! Chung-Sook and Ki-Jung immediately freeze. Ki-Woo realize what he just said and turns pale. He sees -- Mun-Kwang recording everything on her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Now I get it. (nods ) I knew something wasn’t right-- Mun-Kwang plays back the footage she just shot --

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO, (VIDEO)
dialogues.text: Ow! Dad, my foot! Ki-Woo’s face and voice are clearly recorded on video.  81. Finally everything comes together for Mun-Kwang. Ki-Woo is devastated.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Now I get it. You’re alla family. A family that scams people together.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: It’s not like that--

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: I knew something was off when Yun was fired for no reason. You despicable--

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Listen, sis--

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: I’m not your sister, you life- ruining bitch. Mun-Kwang shows Chung-Sook her phone. MUN-KWANG (CONT’D) Why don’t I send this little video to Mrs. Park right now? The video is already being prepped for transfer on her messenger app. Ki-Woo and family are sweating. Ki-Tek, still a little ti from the whiskey, says quietly to Ki-Jung --

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: There’s probably no reception down here. Ki-Jung looks at her phone.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: Actually it’s pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Please. We really need these jobs, and we went through a lot to get them. We’re not scam artists. We'’re--  82.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Shut up! I don’t give a shit! I don’t care if we all go to prison. I’1l fucking end everything right here!

dialogues.speaker: SHUT UP
dialogues.text: Ki-Tek thunders loudly, silencing everyone in the room. K frowns and covers his ears. Mun-Kwang KI-TEK (CONT’D) Are you crazy, lady! is puzzled by Ki-Tek’s random outburst. KI-TEK (CONT’D) Imagine how upset the Parks would be if they saw the video. (screaming) They are nice people! And they’ve shown nothing but kindness! Why would you do that to them!

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: What the--

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Erase it. Now. If you erase it-- (burps) Then we can talk. Then I will consider your demands-- He seems to be doing the method-acting thing, playing ‘sc Ki-Tek,’ but no one’s really buying. He’s making zero sen They all just look around.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: (to Chung-Sook) What's wrong with your husband?

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: (sighs) I apologize on his behalf. Now let’s all calm down-- Kun-Sae is watching the drama unfold when he suddenly los balance and nearly falls. He’s still weak. Mun-Kwang sticks her phone out like a gun as she grabs Ku  76 83.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Back off! Or I’m going to hit send! Ki-Tek and family flinch. They slowly back off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s pour sofa, and Ki-Tek an raised. Mun-Kwang Out of no’ anchor. MUN-KWANG (CONT’D) Let’s get you upstairs. You need some fresh air.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: All of you go upstairs and stay in one place. If you move one inch out of my sight, I’m hitting send!

dialogues.speaker: ION
dialogues.text: ing outside. Kun-Sae is lying facedown on the large Mun-Kwang is on top giving him a massage. d crew are kneeling in the corner with their arms

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: It’s funny. Your phone. It’s like a nuclear button.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: They all hide their tails when you say you'll press the button. (laughs) You're like North Korea. The phone is Kim Jong-Un’s nuke! sits up straight like a military cadet.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: (North Korean accent) Upon seeing the atrocious acts committed by the family of depraved bandits on mobile camera, our Dear Leader Kim Jong-Un determined to deliver fiery justice-- where she starts impersonating a North Korean news Kun-Sae laughs like a little kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed your impressions.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Ignoring the cowardly ruling of the United Nations Security Council, our Dear Leader announced that he would execute the family of delinquents by firing squad.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: (laughing) No one does commie impressions better than you. I love you, babe. Ki-Tek and family stare at Mun-Kwang and Kun-Sae incredul Who are these people?

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: What are you looking at! Keep your heads down! They all look down. Mun-Kwang starts recording with her cell phone again, pan from the family members to the scattered food and booze b on the floor. MUN-KWANG (CONT’D) Scumbags. Look at this debauchery. This is how you treat the sublime living room created by the great Namgoong Hyunja? Kun-Sae looks out at the garden.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: A great living room it is... Remember, honey? How we would sit here when the weather was nice, looking out at the garden. So enchanting.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: It was. Park would be at work. The kids at school. Yon-Kyo would go out shopping, and the house would be so quiet. You would come up, and we would have tea together.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: Yes. Royal Milk Tea.  77 78 79 85.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: We would enjoy the view, listening to Rachmaninoff on the bluetooth speaker-- Mun-Kwang is lost in sweet reverie when -- Chung-Sook suddenly runs toward the sofa. Like a lineback rushing a quarterback, she rams the sofa with her hefty f Knocking Mun-Kwang off balance and making her drop the ph Immediately Ki-Tek dives after the phone -- While Mun-Kwang tries to retrieve it -- Then Ki-Woo lunges toward Mun-Kwang -- Then Kun-Sae after him -- And of course Ki-Jung has to jump after Kun-Sae. Six bodies desperately intertwined. Twelve hands clawing. fingers outstretched toward the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The view from outside. Through the thick curtain of rain, see six people, none of whom actually live in the house, chaotically brawling inside. A surreal sight. The rain dr out the sound. Ki-Jung extracts herself from the melee and runs toward t kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Jung opens the fridge. She grabs a BLACK PLASTIC BAG f inside and runs back to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mun-Kwang has the phone back, but it’s far from over. Chu Sook is choking her from behind, and Ki-Woo is beside her trying to pry the phone away. We see Ki-Tek wrestling Kun nearby. Ki-Jung rushes back to the living room with the black bag pours the contents -- A DOZEN OR SO PEACHES -- over Mun-K head!  86. Mun-Kwang screams. Ki-Jung picks up one of the peaches and squashes it again Mun-Kwang’s face.

dialogues.speaker: AAAAH
dialogues.text: Mun-Kwang sticks her tongue out and starts coughing viole She rolls on the floor, clutching her swollen throat, all Ki-Woo to snatch her phone. At the same time Ki-Tek subdues Kun-Sae, and the family s have everything under control. Until -- The LIVING ROOM PHONE begins to ring. Chung-Sook checks her cell phone. She sees several missed calls from “Mrs. Park.” Shit. When the landline continues to ring, the family members s Mun-Kwang and Kun-Sae by covering their mouths. Chung-Sook answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hel--1lo?

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: You're there! You know how to make japaguri, right? Spicy jajang udon?

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Japaguri?

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (into the phone) It’s Da-Song’s favorite. If you start cooking now, it’ll be ready by the time we get there. There’s some Prime flank steak in the fridge so you should put that in too. Rain batters the Mercedes. Da-Song is in the backseat wit eyes closed. He looks pissed. He’s taken Da-Hae’s reality canceling headphones and is wearing them over his ears.  87. Yon-Kyo glances back from the passenger seat. YON-KYO (CONT’D) (into the phone; quiet) It was complete hell. The stream at the campsite flooded and we had to pack up our tents, but Da-Song just refused to leave. He was crying and yelling-- (sighs) We barely got him in the car, and now we’re on our way. I’m counting on the japaguri! It has to be ready!

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: (pale) So-- You’re almost here?

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: Eight minutes, according to navigation.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: I see... Eight minutes. Ki-Tek, Ki-Woo, and Ki-Jung are completely aghast.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: You should start now. You’re the best! Yon-Kyo hangs up. The family members all look at each other blankly. What t fuck do we do? The living room is still wildly littered with whiskey bot plates, peaches... Chung-Sook closes her eyes and takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: (quiet) What the hell is a japaguri?

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: Look it up. The recipe’s online. Ki-Woo is completely numb. He’s just standing there, stil of breath from the fracas, when --  82 88.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Ki-Woo) What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: I don’t know... This wasn’t part of the plan. They’re all standing around when Ki-Tek suddenly twists K Sae’s arm. Ki-Tek has a manic glow about him. His eyes ar bloodshot.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Move! Hurry! At Ki-Tek’s command, the family jump into action. Ki-Jung starts clearing the bottles with lightning speed, Ki-Tek drags Kun-Sae toward the basement. Ki-Woo roughly pulls up Mun-Kwang. Her eyes are heavily swollen like she just went through ten rounds with Mike T She coughs incessantly as she is hauled away. Chung-Sook is solely focused on the japaguri. She looks u recipe while putting water on the stove. She rips open tw packs of noodles -- jajang ramen and instant udon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Tek pushes Kun-Sae down the stairs into the secret roo He’s rough, scary. And it’s not acting. Even in this dire situation, Kun-Sae can’t stop his laugh

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: (laughing nervously) You don’t have to do this. Let’s all sit down and talk. Ki-Tek shuts Kun-Sae up by throwing him on the floor. Ki- then looks through the miscellaneous crap in the room and a power cord. He is tying Kun-Sae with it when -- Ki-Woo rushes down the stairs with Mun-Kwang. He also loo for something to tie Mun-Kwang with. She’s barely breathi and is only half-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: I’ll take care of them. You go and help Ki-Jung.  83 89.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Okay. Ki-Woo is still numb. He has no focus in his eyes. No lon the man with the plan. He just does as he’s told. He hurr up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chung-Sook methodically lays out the ramen soup packets o counter and starts cooking the flank steak. Ki-Woo comes up from the basement. He runs past her and g into the --

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Where Ki-Jung is kicking foods and plates under the furni She moves fast, with purpose. Ki-Woo is looking at her bl when -- He hears the Mercedes arriving in the garage. He panics. He sees Da-Hae’s yellow journal on top of the coffee table and picks it up. He hurries up to the second floor. Chung-Sook stirs the noodles with great speed. She soon h the Park family walking up the garage stairs. Ki-Jung stops everything and picks up the remaining peach She hides under the large coffee table. A disgruntled Da-Song appears first and stalks across the living room. From under the coffee table, Ki-Jung sees -- Yon-Kyo running after Da-Song. She points to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Da-Song! Look what Chung-Sook made! It’s japaguri, your favorite! Da-Song ignores the steaming bowl of japaguri and walks u stairs. An equally pissed Da-Hae comes up behind him and snatches headphones off his ears. She stomps ahead of him.  84 85 86 90. INT. MANSION - DA-HAE’S ROOM - NIGHT 84 Ki-Woo closes the box of journals and puts the combinatio back on. He quickly hides under the bed. Da-Hae walks inside moments later and throws herself on t bed. The bottom of the mattress sinks and nearly touches Woo’s nose. Da-Hae turns up the volume on her phone. Music escapes fr her headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Tek finishes tying Kun-Sae and moves onto Mun-Kwang. S still hyperventilating, and her eyes are swollen shut. Ki approaches with the cord when -- Mun-Kwang suddenly gets up and shoves Ki-Tek to the side. runs up the stairs. Ki-Tek chases her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yon-Kyo gives up on talking to Da-Song. She walks down to kitchen where Chung-Sook is waiting with the japaguri. At the same time, Chung-Sook sees Mun-Kwang running up fr storage basement. With the pot still in her hands, she sw turns toward the door and -- POW! -- Kicks Mun-Kwang in the face! Mun-Kwang tumbles down and slams her head hard on one of steps. Looks like at least a concussion. Ki-Tek witnesses the fall from below and gasps. Yon-Kyo walks into the kitchen, having missed the devasta kick by a mere millisecond. She sits at the dining table.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. You should eat this.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you...

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Wait. No. I'’11 give it to Dong- Ik. You put the steak in, right?  87 88 91. Chung-Sook is too worried about Mun-Kwang to be annoyed b Kyo’s flip-flopping. She looks down at the bottom of stai where -- Mun-Kwang lies unconscious with her head rammed into the Ki-Tek soon drags her out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Tek pulls Mun-Kwang’s limp body through the steel door leads to the secret room. He slides the cabinet back in p to cover the entrance. He sees that Mun-Kwang is unconscious and starts panickin slaps her in the face. He’s relieved when Mun-Kwang lets weak moan. Ki-Tek starts tying her with a cord when he hears a stran noise coming from below. He rushes down the stairs to see Kun-Sae, arms still tied, banging his head against a seri electrical switches on the wall. A truly bizarre sight.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: Mr. Park is home. This is my welcome home ritual. Above Kun-Sae, Ki-Tek sees a tall, open space. The hollow beneath the garage stairs. We hear Dong-Ik’s FOOTSTEPS he up to the living room. Kun-Sae continues to bang on the switches. Ki-Tek sees th the lines from the switches go all the way up to the entr

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you staring at? I do this everyday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dong-Ik walks up from the garage, the lights above him one by one, in sequence. That’s when we realize -- The MOTION-SENSOR LIGHTS that we noticed throughout the f weren't motion-sensor lights after all. It was Kun-Sae’s ‘performance’ welcoming Dong-Ik home.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Babe, have some japaguri. I put some steak in.  89 90 92.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) No thanks. I’m going up to take a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kun-Sae sings a silly, improvised song as he gleefully ba the switches with his forehead --

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: (singing) Welcome back, what a hard day you must have had at work / Welcome back, Mr. Park we love you so much

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (re: lights) That sensor is all bonkers. Yon-Kyo talks to Chung-Sook as she shoves japaguri and fl steak in her mouth. She looks up. YON-KYO (CONT’D) I guess there are still some things you need to learn about us. You think we're weird right? (slurps ramen) We go out of our way to indulge Da-Song. Treat him like some kind of crown prince.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Not at all--

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: You have to understand. Da-Song needs special care. He’s... not well. We've been helping him with trauma therapy and art therapy. You see, he went through a traumatic event when he was little.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: What kind of--

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Do you believe in ghosts?

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Ghosts?  93.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: When Da-Song was in first grade, he saw a ghost. Yon-Kyo tells the story as she noisily slurps her ramen. Chung-Sook’s spine tingles. A creepy silence surrounds th kitchen. Ki-Jung listens intently from under the coffee table. YON-KYO (CONT’D) That year we threw him a big birthday party at home. At night, when we were all asleep, Da-Song snuck back down to the kitchen because he couldn’t stop thinking about the cake. You see, the fresh cream on that cake was just divine.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: He was crouched over there in front of the refrigerator, eating cake with his fingers when -- Chung-Sook is riveted. YON-KYO (CONT’D) He saw something. Over there. In the living room window. A dark figure--

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: (spooked) In the garden?

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: No, in the kitchen. Yon-Kyo points to the living room window. YON-KYO (CONT’D) See? You can see the kitchen reflected in the window.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: My goodness.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: He saw a dark figure looking over his shoulders. A ghost.  94. As CAMERA WHIP PANS to the living room window, we transit a--

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: We see the kitchen reflected in the living room window. D Song is sitting on the floor plowing into his cake. We see a DARK FIGURE behind Da-Song. The ghost. He just stands there, watching Da-Song eat.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT
dialogues.text: YON-KYO (CONT’D) I heard a scream and rushed down the stairs. (tears building) When I found him, his eyes were rolled back, and he was foaming at the mouth, shaking uncontrollably

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Have you seen a child going through a seizure? It’s awful. If you don’t perform first aid in the first fifteen minutes, it’s over. You have to take him to the hospital as soon as you can. Yon-Kyo shakes off the memories and returns to her ditzy YON-KYO (CONT’D) Dong-Ik was away on a business trip, and I was all by myself. Anyway, after that horrible experience, we’ve tried to go away for his birthday every year. Last year we went to my parents’ house. This year, camping-- She angrily tosses her noodles. YON-KYO (CONT’D) Now it’s all gone to crap.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: I see. Chung-Sook realizes who the ghost was but keeps mum.  91 95.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Dong-Ik doesn’t take it seriously. Growing pains, he says. And he says living in a haunted house actually brings good fortune. Good for business or something. (slurps ramen) You know what though? Business has been very good these past few years. It’s funny-- As Yon-Kyo rambles on -- CAMERA MOVES IN on Da-Song’s drawing on the wall. It focu on the “schizophrenia zone.” We see the dark, ambiguous s drawn in it. The shape, which vaguely resembles the ghost, MATCH CUTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kun-Sae’s dark face staring back at Ki-Tek. Ki-Tek looks at the numerous notes and drawings covering walls. He sees photos and magazine interviews of Namgoong Hyunja and Dong-Ik. A record of Kun-Sae’s devolving mind. Ki-Tek feels like he’s in the twilight zone.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: God... I can’t believe you lived here for so long. I guess you had no choice...

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: Plenty of people live underground. More if you count semi-underground apartments! Kun-Sae laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: So what was your plan? You didn’t even have one, did you?

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: (laughing) I like it here. It almost feels like I grew up here. This might as well be my official address. Kun-Sae rambles on incoherently, his eyes glazed and out focus.  92 93 96. Ki-Tek starts getting scared.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. You have to let me stay here. Ki-Tek finds a roll of duct tape among the mess and start ripping off a piece.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. Talk to my wife. We don’t have to fight. (looking around) Where did she go? She didn’t mean what she said. The woman really has a heart of gold. She stood by me the whole time I was in here. Four long years-- Ki-Tek tapes Kun-Sae’s mouth shut. He then goes to stairs tapes Mun-Kwang’s mouth as well. As he does, he feels something wet behind her head. BLOOD. Ki-Tek’s head spins when he sees the blood on his fingert He runs up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Tek shuts the steel door and ties the handle with wire then pushes the cabinet back in place, sealing off the se doorway. Breathing heavily, he looks up at the thin bar o light coming from the kitchen. INT. MANSION - DA-HAE’S ROOM - NIGHT 93 We’re on Ki-Woo’s stunned face. He is face to face with - JUNIE, who is poking his head under the mattress, having Ki-Woo. Da-Hae looks down at Junie from the bed. She becomes curi when she sees the dog wagging his tail with his head buri under the bed. She bends over to see what it is when -- She hears Yon-Kyo walking up the stairs. She immediately springs back up. Picking up Junie, she walks out to the -

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Where she confronts Yon-Kyo.

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: You're unbelievable.  94 97.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: You didn’t even ask me. I like japaguri too. Yon-Kyo wipes her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: I just--

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: Da-Song didn’t want it so you offered it to Chung-Sook. Then you gave it to Dad. Then instead of asking me, you decided to eat it all by yourself. What, I didn’t cross your mind? Da-Hae and Yon-Kyo bicker down the hall, soon disappearin our sight. Through Da-Hae’s open door, we see Ki-Woo slowly emerging under the bed. He checks the hallway before tiptoeing ove the stairs, where he sees -- Chung-Sook waving at him from below ‘Come down.’ Chung-So also gestures toward the basement stairs from which -- Ki-Tek carefully walks out. Once they’re all together the start toward the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family quietly crosses the living room toward the gar entrance. They stop. They make a quick detour to the coff table where Ki-Jung is still hiding. They are helping her out from under the table when they suddenly hear -- FOOTSTEPS thundering down the stairs. Fast. Ki-Jung hides under the table again. Having nowhere to go Woo and Ki-Tek also crawl underneath. Chung-Sook turns to see -- Da-Song running down the stairs, dressed in a raincoat. H wearing a backpack and also has the folded TEEPEE strappe across his shoulders.  98.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Da-Song! Slow down! Dangling all kinds of camping gear over his raincoat, Da- storms through the living room and heads to the garden. H opens the glass door and jumps out into the pouring rain. He then starts building the teepee in the middle of the y He’s quick, efficient. A true Scout. Yon-Kyo and Dong-Ik yell at Da-Song as they rush down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Da-Song! Are you crazy!

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: Da-Song Park! (laughs) I can’t believe this. Yon-Kyo and Dong-Ik hesitate at the door, still in their pajamas. Chung-Sook brings two umbrellas, and they finall out. Da-Song has already finished setting up the teepee and is working on the inside. Ki-Tek, Ki-Woo and Ki-Jung attempt to make a run while Yo and Dong-Ik are outside. They start wiggling their way ou when -- Da-Hae comes running down the stairs. They quickly wiggle back in.

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: (English) What the fuck is going on here? Da-Hae watches her parents pleading with Da-Song in the r Pathetic. She shoots a video and sends it to none other t “Mr. Kevin” a.k.a. Ki-Woo Whose phone VIBRATES just a few feet from her under the t Ki-Woo quickly silences his phone. Chung-Sook coughs to cover the sound. She glances over at Hae to see if Da-Hae heard it too. She did. Da-Hae looks around, confused.  99. Ki-Woo hurriedly switches his phone to silence mode. Ki-T and Ki-Jung do the same. Da-Hae’s text messages crowd Ki-Woo’s screen -- SMH Da-Song’s crazy raindance I hate my brother Totes saw this coming. Started losing his shit at camp

dialogues.speaker: LMAO
dialogues.text: Me too Selfie please
/ I miss you
/ No

Why noooooooot / I’m with you right now Da-Hae continues to exchange cringe-inducing love texts w Ki-Woo as she plops down on the sofa. Ki-Tek, Ki-Woo, and Ki-Jung nearly shriek when Da-Hae’s w feet come within inches of their faces. Meanwhile Yon-Kyo and Dong-Ik give up on Da-Song and retu the living room. Chung-Sook takes their umbrellas and hands them a couple towels. She nervously looks over at the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (to Chung-Sook) You should go sleep in the room. We'll stay here with Da-Song.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: (to Da-Hae) You too. Stop looking at your phone and go to your room. Without answering, Da-Hae gets up and stomps up the stair never looking up once from her phone. Chung-Sook looks back at the living room with a worried f she goes to the kitchen. Yon-Kyo and Dong-Ik sit down on the sofa, now directly fa Ki-Tek, Ki-Woo, and Ki-Jung.  100. Dong-Ik presses the button on his walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into the radio) Dad to Da-Song, Dad to Da-Song. Currently standing by in the living room. I'11 be here all night so call me if there’s an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: DA-SONG, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: Copy that. Over and out. Da-Song’s voice on the radio sounds excited. He got his w after all. Dong-Ik lets out a weak laugh.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: This is incredible. You don’t think the teepee will leak, do you?

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (sighs) I bought it directly from an American vendor. I think it should be okay.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: Your son is quite unpredictable. Never easy, I'll say. Yon-Kyo feels like it’s her fault.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: He’s been getting better... Look. Signing him up for the Cub Scouts definitely paid off. See how fast he set up that tent. Outside the window, the teepee lights up. Lanterns are li inside, one after another. It’s picturesque. The teepee, emitting a pleasant orange Against the backdrop of beautiful trees. Seen through the shimmering veil of pouring rain. Dong-Ik turns off the living room lights and places a few cushions on Yon-Kyo’s side.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: Let’s just sleep here on the sofa tonight. We’ll be able to see the tent from here.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: That sounds good. That way we can keep an eye on Da-Song.  101. Ki-Tek, Ki-Woo, and Ki-Jung turn ashen. They’re fucked. Dong-Ik lies down in the spooning position behind Yon-Kyo It’s quite romantic. Both of them in their pajamas. Tight snuggled up on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: Hold on. (sniffs) I know that smell.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: This is Mr. Kim’s smell.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Mr. Kim? Are you sure? (sniffs) I don’t know what you’re talking about. Dong-Ik and Yon-Kyo both sniff the air. Ki-Tek becomes nervous. He smells his T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: I guess you don’t know. I sit behind him every day so I know the smell.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Like poor people smell?

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: No. It’s not that strong. It’s more like a subtle aroma that seeps into the air--

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Like old people smell?

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: No, no. How should I put it-- Maybe the smell of an old radish pickle? Or that smell when you’re washing a dirty rag? Ki-Tek tries his best to keep a straight face under the t

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean I like his driving. And the man never crosses the line. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sometimes he teeters very close, but he never actually crosses it. That’s all great. But that smell. It definitely crosses the line. (laughs) It just creeps into the backseat and surrounds you--

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: You think that’s what Da-Song was talking about?

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: It’s hard to explain. I smell it when I ride the subway sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: I haven't ridden the subway in forever.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: There’s this unique smell that subway commuters have-- Ki-Tek, Ki-Woo, and Ki-Jung can do nothing but silently t hit after hit. Ki-Tek is completely expressionless. On the sofa, Dong-Ik slowly slides up his hand and caress Yon-Kyo’s breasts over her pajama top.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (quiet) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: It feels like we’re in the backseat of a car, doesn’t it? Dong-Ik sounds like a horny high school boy. He puts his inside Yon-Kyo’s pajama top and continues fondling her. Yon-Kyo looks up at the kitchen and the stairs to make su one is watching. She closes her eyes and gives in to plea

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (moaning) Clockwise. Dong-Ik moves his hand as instructed. It starts migrating below Yon-Kyo’s navel. Their bodies grow closer. Breathin becomes labored.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: Do you have a pair of really cheap panties?  95 103.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Cheap panties?

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: Those panties that Yun left behind. Something like that. Real cheap and tacky. Dong-Ik’s hand slips inside Yon-Kyo’s underwear. He makes ‘vibrate’ like a sex toy. Yon-Kyo’s lips part from pleasure. She gasps.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: No, I don’t have-- something so crude.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: I must be a pervert. I get hard thinking about those cheap, trashy pair of underpants.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Where would I find something so-- horrendous. (gasps) Down. Ki-Jung tries to keep a cool face as the rich couple cont to malign her underwear. Ki-Tek’s face is dark. He’s more humiliated than she is. Meanwhile Yon-Kyo is pushed closer toward climax by the underpants talk. She bites her lips but is hardly able to suppress her moans. Ki-Tek, Ki-Woo, and Ki-Jung hear everything under the table. A heavy fatigue comes over Ki-Tek’s face. Time passes slo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiding in the dark kitchen, Chung-Sook looks over at the room where the Parks are now sleeping. She sends a text - / They’re passed out / Move out 1 by 1 Under the table, Ki-Tek receives the text. He signals Ki- to go first. She slides out and starts crawling toward th garage stairs. Ki-Woo goes next. Once they are safely acr they wait for Ki-Tek.  96 97 104. Ki-Tek is slowly making his way when -- A STRONG BEAM OF LIGHT suddenly penetrates the living roo flashlight. Ki-Tek quickly flattens himself on the floor. light searches the living room before settling on Yon-Kyo Dong-Ik on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain is still heavy. We see Da-Song poking his head o shining his flashlight at Yon-Kyo and Dong-Ik in the livi room. He turns glum when he sees them sleeping. He angrily wave flashlight, trying to wake them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Tek curls into a tight ball to avoid the wildly roamin light. He is slowly inching toward the stairs when -- The T-667 WALKIE-TALKIE on the coffee table crackles to l We hear Da-Song’s voice through the fuzz --

dialogues.speaker: DA-SONG, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: Mayday! Mayday! Dad, come in! Ki-Tek freezes. There’s nowhere to hide. He can only clos his eyes and hope he doesn’t get discovered. Dong-Ik wakes up and picks up the walkie-talkie. He looks the window and sees the flashlight blinking inside the te

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: (into the radio) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Is that Da-Song ? What’s going on? Yon-Kyo and Dong-Ik are too concerned with Da-Song to not Ki-Tek hunched over in the dark merely a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: DA-SONG, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: I can’t go to sleep. Over. Dong-Ik and Yon-Kyo can’t help but laugh.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: (into the radio) So come inside! Let’s all go to sleep in our comfy beds.  98 99 100 101 105.

dialogues.speaker: DA-SONG, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: No! The transmission cuts out. Dong-Ik and Yon-Kyo laugh and Back to the sofa it is. They return to sleep. When all is quiet, Ki-Tek starts moving again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Tek flips up the door switch before quickly flipping i down. The garage door goes up about one-and-a-half feet b stopping. Ki-Jung and Ki-Woo hold their breath. Did anyone in the h hear the door? When they don’t hear anything, they crawl through the nar opening and walk out into the rain. Ki-Tek presses the ‘down’ switch and slips through the cr before it completely closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ON the surveillance camera above the gate, the sever wires dangling below. RACK FOCUS TO REVEAL -- Ki-Tek, Ki-Woo, and Ki-Jung sneaking out of the house and walking down the empty road. Rain pours as they make thei down the winding road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Tek and the kids trudge silently through the rain. The walking on the side of a gloomy four-lane road, no longer the nice part of town. They don’t bother going into a sto buy an umbrella. They don’t bother hailing a cab. They ju walk, their faces steeped in anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look down on a hillside neighborhood. A different hill view. Working class. Illuminated by the lights of low-inc apartments. The gates of poverty. Ki-Tek, Ki-Woo, and Ki-Jung stop under an overpass, out o breath. We see them as silhouettes.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: (panting) So what did you do?  106.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: The basement.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: I tied them up so they can’t come out.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? Ki-Tek is silent.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do we do now? What’s the goddamn plan? Ki-Tek doesn’t have one. Rain drowns the silence. Ki-Woo, still in a daze, mumbles to himself --

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: What would Min-Hyuk do?

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: Min-Hyuk wouldn't have gotten himself in this mess in the first place! Ki-Jung is about to lash out further when Ki-Tek calmly s forward.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Calm down. Both of you. Ki-Jung seethes. KI-TEK (CONT’D) We made it out of that house, didn’t we?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: We did.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: No one else knows about what happened in the house. Am I right? Ki-Jung nods. KI-TEK (CONT’D) So as far as I’m concerned nothing happened in there. Do you understand?  102 103 107. Ki-Tek sounds like a real father. Firm. Reassuring. Ki-Jung actually listens to him. KI-TEK (CONT’D) I know what I’m doing. Daddy has a plan. So you two just erase everything that happened today from your memory.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: Okay. Ki-Woo nods.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Let’s go home and wash up. With that, Ki-Tek steps back into the rain. Ki-Woo and Ki follow. UNSETTLING MUSIC creeps in over the rain. EXT. KI-TEK’S NEIGHBORHOOD - STREET - NIGHT 102 Ki-Tek, Ki-Woo, and Ki-Jung walk through the relentless downpour, passing shabby, low-rent buildings. They hear SHOUTING, SIRENS in the distance. They turn the corner to A completely flooded alley! All the roads leading to thei apartment are covered in knee-deep water. Total pandemonium. Sewage backflows. A SEMI-BASEMENT RESI scoops water out of his apartment with a bucket. Ki-Tek stares in horror. He hurries toward the apartment. Woo and Ki-Jung splash in after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Tek has to use great strength to open the door. He ste inside to see brown flood water pouring in through the wi The water is already up to his chest. His foot touches something, and he reaches into the dirty to pick up -- A live KING CRAB flailing its legs. Ki-Tek stares at the crab. It’s too surreal. His home has become an underwater habitat. He throws the crab away. Hi face fills with despair.  104 105 106 108. Meanwhile Ki-Woo crosses toward the window. He tries to c it to stop further flooding when --

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Ow! He feels a shock of electricity as soon as he touches it. quickly withdraws his hand.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Were you shocked? Don’t touch it! Don’t touch the windows! Just get what you need!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Jung pries the door open and trudges toward the toilet which is spewing shit water like an Icelandic geyser. Ki-Jung barely closes the lid and climbs on top. She open square panel on the ceiling and reaches in to find -- A PACK OF CIGARETTES AND A LIGHTER that she had hidden th We see a few folded bills stashed in the cellophane wrap. Ki-Jung lights a cigarette amidst the raging flood. The surging sewage lifts her toilet seat up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Woo is going around packing a few essentials into a GR when -- Something touches his foot in the water. He bends over an reaches into the murky depths, eventually finding -- The VIEWING STONE that Min-Hyuk gave the family as a gift Ki-Woo pants heavily as he hugs the rock. It’s like he ju found a precious treasure. Over the image of the stone veiled by the hazy, undulatin water, DARK MUSIC begins to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kun-Sae is facing away from Mun-Kwang, straining to remov tape off her mouth with his tied-up hands. Mun-Kwang sweats profusely and falls in and out of consciousness. When Kun-Sae finally rips off the tape --  107 109. Mun-Kwang jumps up and staggers toward the toilet. Kun-Sae watches in horror as she throws up into the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: (through tape) Mmm-mmmm! (Mun-Kwang! ) Mun-Kwang moans. She’s in a lot of pain. She gets up and starts toward Kun-Sae but loses her balance. Kun-Sae throws himself to catch her, but she falls flat o floor.

dialogues.speaker: MUN-KWANG
dialogues.text: Vomiting is a symptom of-- Kun-Sae screams something to Mun-Kwang, but his cries are muffled by the tape on his mouth. They’re heard as primal animalistic grunts. MUN-KWANG (CONT’D) It’s supposed to be a symptom of-- Kun-Sae stares helplessly. MUN-KWANG (CONT’D) (weak) Honey-- (laughs) Chung-Sook. She-- That bitch kicked me in the face-- Mun-Kwang laughs like her husband, mumbling incoherently. voice dwindles. She’s near the end. She curls up in the corner next to the toilet. Kun-Sae shouts through the tape. He wails painfully like hurt beast. The scream continues over to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is now up to Ki-Tek’s chin. He stands at the entrance and looks back at the apartment like a captain t one last look at his sinking ship. The water inside has merged with the floodwater on the st and has formed a continuous brown ocean extending through the neighborhood. UNNERVING MUSIC continues. A dark wave of water rolls ove screen and we CUT TO --  108 109 110 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the dark room, we find a crazed Kun-Sae banging on wall switches with his bloody forehead. His face is a mas sweat, blood, snot. We see Mun-Kwang’s lifeless body on the floor behind him. Kun-Sae furiously bangs the switches with his head, overc with pain and sorrow. INT/EXT. MANSION - DA-SONG’S TEEPEE - NIGHT 109 Da-Song unzips the tent and looks at the living room acro garden. He sees the lights blinking randomly in the front entrance. He starts timing the blinks. He takes out his notebook an starts transcribing them as dots and dashes. He consults MORSE CODE CHART in the back of his Cub Scout book but ca seem to make out any words. CAMERA TRACKS IN on the lights as they blink more and mor frantically. UNSETTLING MUSIC reaches a crescendo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with rows and rows of EVACUEES from flooded areas. Currently sleeping. The lights are off, and the gym is illuminated by the faint glow of daybreak. Ki-Tek and the kids are among the Evacuees. Ki-Jung is completely knocked out. It’s been a rough night. Ki-Woo tightly holds the viewing stone as he lies wide aw His eyes are bloodshot.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: So-- Ki-Woo looks at Ki-Jung to make sure she is sleeping. KI-WOoO (CONT’D) Your plan. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?  111.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: You said you had a plan. What are we going to do about-- (quiet) The basement. Ki-Tek is silent for a long moment. His face is cold and emotionless.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Do you want to know how you make a foolproof plan?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Don’t plan at all. Have no plan. Ki-Woo, confused. KI-TEK (CONT’D) If you plan, something will always go wrong. That’s life. (then) Look around. Do you think these people got up this morning and said “Tonight I’m going to sleep on a dirty floor with hundreds of strangers”? But look where they are now. Look where we are. Ki-woo is hardly consoled. KI-TEK (CONT’D) That’s why you should never plan. If you don’t have a plan, you can’t fail. You can’t do anything wrong. Doesn’t matter if you kill someone or commit fucking treason. Nothing fucking matters. You understand? Ki-Tek talks quietly. There’s a hostility in his voice. H face drips with fatigue. Ki-Woo is scared. He’s never seen his father like this. H hugs the rock more tightly.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: For what?  112.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Everything. I’m going to make it right.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Stop talking nonsense. (re: viewing stone) Why are you hugging that thing?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: This? Ki-Woo looks down at the stone. KI-WOO (CONT’D) It wants to be with me. Ki-Tek looks at Ki-Woo. He’s acting strange. KI-WOoO (CONT’D) It’s true. It keeps following me.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: (to himself) I knew it was a sign when Min-Hyuk gave it to me. A symbolic gift... Ki-Woo stares blankly ahead. We have no idea what he’s thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight fills the living room. Yon-Kyo walks up to the w and looks up at the marvelous sky. She sees the tent in t garden. Dong-Ik slowly rises from the sofa behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dong-Ik walks over to the raindrop-covered teepee and car peeks inside -- Da-Song is finally asleep after the long and eventful nig Dong-Ik smiles and gives the okay sign to Yon-Kyo in the room.  113 114 115 113.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Jessica! Sorry to call you so early on a Sunday. Are you free for lunch today? We’re planning a surprise party for Da-Song. Yon-Kyo is sitting at her vanity, chatting excitedly into phone. It’s on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A groggy Ki-Jung answers the phone. We see rows of people sleeping behind her.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: (into the phone) You're having a birthday party?

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yes. Da-Song would be so thrilled to see you there.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (into the phone) The food will be amazing. Pasta, gratin, salmon steak... You know I’m an excellent chef, right? You have to come.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (into the phone) You have to be here by one o’clock at the latest. And we'll count today as a lesson. (English) You know what I mean? (Korean) See you very soon! Yon-Kyo lays down a barrage before abruptly hanging up. We see Da-Hae standing behind Yon-Kyo. She looks over her mom's shoulders with twinkling eyes.  116 114.

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: Hey, Mom. The birthday party-- Should I invite Kevin?

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (turning back) What an excellent idea! Why not? You call him.

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: On it! Da-Hae, ecstatic, runs to her room. As she does -- We see Dong-Ik coming up the stairs behind her. He walks the master bedroom and throws himself on the bed. He craw under the covers to go back to sleep. Yon-Kyo calls him from the dressing room --

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Sleep, sleep. You had a long night. You need some more rest.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: Thanks. (yawns ) Don’t you have to do the rounds?

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Yep. Wine shop, bakery, florist, grocery store-- I’m on top of it. I already called Mr. Kim and told him to come early. I’m going to pay him extra for today.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: Perfect. Dong-Ik gives her a thumbs up with his eyes closed. Yon-Kyo smiles, pleased with Dong-Ik’s approval. She open closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evacuees surround a pile of SECOND-HAND CLOTHES, looking something salvageable. Donations from a local organizatio Ki-Jung looks frustrated. She doesn’t see anything approp for the party. She looks at Ki-Tek, who is also frantically digging thro the pile with bloodshot eyes.  117 115. Behind them, Ki-Woo is still lying on the floor. He opens eyes and looks at his phone -- “7 Missed Calls - Da-Hae” Ki-Woo sits up and goes through Da-Hae’s text messages. H puts the VIEWING STONE in the gray bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chung-Sook busily prepares ingredients for the party. Her are red. She hasn’t slept at all. A refreshed Yon-Kyo hops down the stairs and calls Chung- out to the living room. She looks out at the sunny garden

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: I want you to go to the storage basement. We should have about ten party tables in there.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Let’s bring them all out. Clean them so they’re bright and shiny. We'll set them up in a semi-circle around Da-Song’s tent-- Yon-Kyo tries to show Chung-Sook with her hands. No, not right. Then -- YON-KYO (CONT’D) Crane Formation! You know, right? The formation that General Yi Soon Shin famously used during the Battle of Hansan Island. Chung-Sook’s face says, ‘How the fuck should I know.” She quickly hides her expression. YON-KYO (CONT’D) Think of Da-Song’s tent as a Japanese battleship. We’l1l surround it in a semi-circle, like the wings of a crane. The barbecue grill will go next to the tent--  118 119 120 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chung-Sook struggles to pull out the party tables from th faintly lit basement. She stops to take a breath. A chill silence envelops the room. Chung-Sook looks at the jar cabinet covering the secret d She can almost hear Mun-Kwang and Kun-Sae’s breathing com from the other side. She stares at the cabinet for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An upscale food market. Organic produce beautifully displ Ki-Tek is at the cash register bagging items as a CASHIER them. Yon-Kyo is next to him talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (laughing) That sounds great. Bring your husband too! And please -- don’t bring any gifts. Yon-Kyo hands the Cashier her credit card. YON-KYO (CONT’D) I just want you to come and enjoy the food! It seems like it’s going to be a large-scale affair. Ki-T follows Yon-Kyo out with huge bags of fruits and vegetabl Yon-Kyo’s shrill laughter puts Ki-Tek on edge. He squints bloodshot eyes. YON-KYO (CONT’D) (into the phone) Come. You can take a break from cooking today. (nodding) Yes, of course. Daytime is the best time for vino! (laughs) Well, we'd be so grateful if you could sing a song at the party.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121 122 117. YON-KYO (CONT’D) (into the phone) No dress code. It’s just a casual affair. You can come in your pajamas if you want. (laughs) And please, no gifts. I just want you to come and enjoy. That’1l be the best gift for us. (then) You have a Mini Cooper, right? Great. We can squeeze it in next to our car. It’ll fit just fine. Yon-Kyo talks on the phone as she walks past fancy vintag wines. She picks several out and gives them to Ki-Tek. Ki-Tek’s face grows dark as he follows Yon-Kyo with the h basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chung-Sook is setting up the tables in the ‘Crane Formati around the tent. Da-Song is still sleeping inside. She is sweating and grunting away by herself when she sees -- A pajama-clad Dong-Ik walking toward the tent. He smiles awkwardly at Chung-Sook before checking inside the tent. turns to Chung-Sook and puts a finger on his lips -- ‘Shh

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
