dialogues.text: (silent) He’s still sleeping. Chung-Sook nods and proceeds quietly. It’s hard to set up bulky tables without making noise. Dong-Ik scratches his belly as he returns to the house.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Did you see the sky today? Crystal clear. Zero air pollution. Rain washed it all away. Of course camping was a major fail because of the rain, but we get to have a garden party instead, yay! It was actually a blessing in disguise.  123 124 118. Yon-Kyo is jabbering away when she suddenly smells someth and holds her nose. Ki-Tek’s scent must have drifted her Ki-Tek sees Yon-Kyo covering her nose through the rearvie mirror. It bothers him. Yon-Kyo rolls down the window slightly. YON-KYO (CONT’D) I almost forgot. Please please please don’t bring any presents. You have to promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun shines brightly on the garden. PARTY GUESTS sit a tables decorated with flowers. Chung-Sook busily shuttles from the kitchen. Some of the Guests have already finished the bottles of w their table. People are having a good time. INT. MANSION - DA-HAE’S ROOM - DAY 124 We see the party downstairs through Da-Hae’s window. Colo GIFT BOXES are stacked high in front of Da-Song’s teepee. Ki-Woo looks out the window with a blank expression. Da-H stands beside him, staring.

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: You were somewhere else, weren’t you?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: When we were kissing just now. You were somewhere else. Right? KI-WwoO No...

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: Stop lying. You’re still thinking about something else. Ki-Woo sees the crowd mingling effortlessly in the garden  119. A KID taking pictures with his Leica, a WOMAN passionatel explaining something to other Guests with a bottle of win her hand, a MALE GUEST chopping firewood next to the gril looking utterly cool doing it. Everyone looks genuinely h

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: (re: Guests) They’re all so gorgeous. Even though they had to come at the last minute. So cool. Laid back. Da-Hae looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Da-Hae.

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Do I look like I belong here?

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Do I look like I belong in this house? Da-Hae has no idea why he’s asking. Ki-Woo, still numb, pads over to the desk where his bag i

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: I need to go downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: Stay. Let’s hang out.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: I need to go down.

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: Those people are boring. Da-Hae hugs Ki-Woo tightly.

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just stay with me.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: (sotto) Not there. Further down.  125 120. With a grim face, Ki-Woo removes the suiseki from his bag

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: Whoa. What is that thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dong-Ik and Ki-Tek hide behind the trees where the Guests see them, dressed as NATIVE AMERICANS. Dong-Ik puts feathers and other finishing touches on Ki-T costume.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: I can’t believe we’re doing this. Look at us. A couple of middle- aged men, wearing silly costumes--

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: It’s fine... Dong-Ik and Ki-Tek both laugh awkwardly. Ki-Tek looks exhausted. It’s been a nonstop shitshow sinc yesterday -- the flood, the evacuation center, spending t morning as Yon-Kyo’s shopping assistant, and now the elab role-playing. He just stands there, limply holding the to axe.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: I’m really sorry, Mr. Kim. Mrs. Park made me do this. I didn’t have a choice. (then) It’s really simple. There’s going to be a cake ceremony, and Jessica, the art teacher, is going to bring out the cake. She’s walking, walking, walking, she’s going to present the cake-- Then we appear from the trees swinging our axes, ambushing her! Because, you know, we’re the bad guys.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: At that moment, Da-Song, the good Indian, attacks us with his axe. A battle ensues, and Da-Song heroically saves Ms. Jessica and the cake! Everybody applauds. You get the idea. I know it’s ridiculous.  121. Dong-Ik laughs again.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: I guess Mrs. Park enjoys throwing parties.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: I suppose she does. She put a lot of effort into Da-Song’s birthday this year.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: How thoughtful of her. And you too. Dong-Ik senses a tone in Ki-Tek’s voice. KI-TEK (CONT’D) What can you do, I guess. You love them, right? Ki-Tek doesn’t hide the sarcasm, and Dong-Ik notices. Ten rises between them.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: Mr. Kim, you're technically working today, aren’t you?

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: Then just think of this as part of the job. Dong-Ik avoids Ki-Tek’s eyes as he puts another feather o Tek’s headband.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Mr. Park. I think you went over the line.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: No. I mean this. Dong-Ik sees that one of the feathers was pushed too far. tip is poking out from the bottom of the headband. He sti can’t shake the feeling that Ki-Tek was talking about a different ‘line.’ Ki-Tek pushes up the errant feather with his finger.  126 122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chung-Sook sets up the buffet table according to Yon-Kyo’ reference picture. A FOREIGN CHEF is behind her marinating barbecue meat. Wh finishes and takes the meat out to the garden -- Ki-Jung carefully approaches Chung-Sook.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: (whispering) Have you been down there?

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: No, I’ve been too busy.

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: Shouldn’t we try to talk to them? Try to reach an agreement.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: I think so too. We all got too emotional yesterday. Ki-Jung looks around before saying --

dialogues.speaker: KI-JUNG
dialogues.text: I’1l1 go down there and see how they’re doing. Chung-Sook nods. From under the table, she takes out a LA PARTY PLATTER filled with various foods.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Here. Take this with you. I made it for them just in case. They’1ll be more willing to talk if their stomachs are full. Ki-Jung nods. She takes the platter and adds a few more meatballs from the buffet table. She is about to go down the basement when -- She hears Yon-Kyo’s high-pitched laughter coming from the living room.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jessica! I was looking for you! What are you doing there? Come out here. Ki-Jung slowly puts the platter down behind her.  127 128 123. Chung-Sook quickly escapes, taking more food out to the g Yon-Kyo comes in and pulls Ki-Jung out to the --

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Where she shows Ki-Jung a GOURMET CREAM CAKE sitting on t coffee table. YON-KYO (CONT’D) This cake is very symbolic. It has a therapeutic significance, you know, related to Da-Song’s trauma. I want you to bring it out, Jessica. It has to be you. It'll be the highlight of the day! As Yon-Kyo and Ki-Jung admire the cake -- We see Ki-Woo quietly walking down the stairs, out of foc the background. He has the GRAY BAG over his shoulder. He enters the kitchen and walks down to the storage basement

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Woo pushes the jar cabinet to the side, revealing the steel door behind it. He unties the tightly wrapped wires opens the door. He walks down one step at a time, holding his cell phone flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is pitch black. Once he reaches the bottom of th stairs, Ki-Woo removes the viewing stone from the gray ba His hands tremble, and he starts breathing faster. With h cell phone flashlight tucked in his breast pocket, he car makes his way in, eventually finding -- A tied-up Mun-Kwang fallen next to the toilet. Ki-Woo swallows nervously. His legs grow weak and his eye brim with tears as he slowly walks up to Mun-Kwang’s head He raises the stone to strike Mun-Kwang but -- He can’t do it. He just stands there, face covered in snot and tears, sha uncontrollably, when -- We notice a CIRCULAR OBJECT ‘floating’ behind Ki-Woo. A N Kun-Sae has untied his cord and formed a noose with it. H slowly brings it above Ki-Woo’s head.  129 130 124. Ki-Woo is oblivious. He continues to sob and shudder. He finally feels something behind him and looks up but -- Too late. Kun-Sae quickly wraps the noose around Ki-Woo’s and tightens it! Ki-Woo struggles. The viewing stone drop and hits his foot, which causes him to further lose his balance. He is dragged across the floor by Kun-Sae. We can only see Kun-Sae’s maniacal eyes in the darkness a strangles Ki-Woo. Ki-Woo thrashes violently. He can’t breathe and his eyes ready to roll back. Kun-Sae picks up the viewing stone and raises it to deliv final blow. He swings it mightily at Ki-Woo’s head, but - Ki-Woo turns and avoids it at the last moment. Ki-Woo run the stairs, cord still dangling from his neck. Kun-Sae chases Ki-Woo with the stone. Ki-Woo has just made it past the jar cabinet when -- Kun-Sae grabs the cord dragging behind Ki-Woo and pulls i hard. Ki-Woo flies backward into the air and -- SLAM! -- Falls hard on the floor. His wind is knocked out Kun-Sae runs up to Ki-Woo. He raises the stone high and b it down on Ki-Woo’s head! We hear a horrifying crunch as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear applause. One of the Party Guests, an OPERA SINGE starts singing an aria. Ki-Jung is holding the cake. Yon-Kyo lights the candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thirsty Kun-Sae gulps down a large bottle of plum extra He pushes the cabinet back in place and hides the secret doorway. He hears the faint sound of aria coming from above. When turns, we finally see his face -- It’s horrible. And a little ridiculous. Blood from his forehead has dried into a frightening red mask. But a cle rectangle remains where the tape covered his mouth.  131 132 125. Kun-Sae looks down at his feet where Ki-Woo is lying. Blo slowly pooling around Ki-Woo’s head, pushing out the pudd plum extract spilled on the floor. Kun-Sae picks up the viewing stone from the floor and sla Woo's head again! Ki-Woo’s fingers tremble. Is he still conscious? Or was that the last flicker of life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kun-Sae trudges up the stairs and arrives in the bright kitchen. A surreal juxtaposition. His ghostly, blood-smea mask against the pure white kitchen. Out in the garden he sees, through laughing and applauding party guests -- Ki-Jung, holding Da-Song’s birthday cake. Kun-Sae picks up a large kitchen knife from the sink and toward the garden. As soon as he disappears -- Da-Hae comes down the stairs and pokes her head inside th kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: DA-HAE
dialogues.text: Kevin! Kevin, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Jung walks down the ‘aisle’ between the Party Guests, so the candles don’t blow out. An embarrassed but obviously excited Da-Song waits in fro the tent. He watches his favorite teacher Ms. Jessica bri him the cake when -- Everyone SCREAMS, and the crowd parts like the Red Sea. Ki-Jung looks back to see -- Kun-Sae running toward her with the kitchen knife. Ki-Jung shoves the cake in Kun-Sae’s face just as he swin knife. But a beat too late as the knife plunges into her chest. Kun-Sae pulls the knife, and blood plumes from Ki-Jung’s It sprays over the white cream covering exactly half of K Sae’s face. When Ki-Jung falls, Da-Song sees Kun-Sae looming over him dripping with Jessica’s blood. The ghost.  126. Da-Song screams. A truly horrible scream. Louder and two octaves higher than the Guests. His eyes roll back, and h goes into a full-on seizure. We hear Yon-Kyo’s scream fro somewhere in the crowd. Kun-Sae pulls up Ki-Jung and puts the knife to her throat shouts to the Guests --

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE
dialogues.text: Don’t move! Ki-Tek and Dong-Ik are running out from the trees when th stop at Kun-Sae’s voice. The chaotically fleeing Guests a freeze in their tracks. A tense moment. A WHITE BUTTERFLY flies over to Kun-Sae a flutters its wings above his cake-covered head.

dialogues.speaker: KUN-SAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chung-Sook! Where are you! Come out you fucking bitch! Chung-Sook emerges from behind the crowd. Her eyes are se Ki-Jung.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG-SOOK
dialogues.text: Ki-Jung! Wake up! Ki-Jung is bleeding profusely. She lets out a weak moan. CHUNG-SOOK (CONT’D) (screaming) Put pressure on the wound, Ki- Jung! You have to stop the blood! Chung-Sook and Ki-Tek are focused on Ki-Jung while Dong-I Yon-Kyo can’t look away from Da-Song. An agonizing moment both families. No one moves until -- Kun-Sae throws Ki-Jung on the ground and makes a dash for Chung-Sook. People scream, scatter. Chung-Sook turns the grill over, spilling charred meat an firewood over Kun-Sae. Smoke creates a temporary screen. When Kun-Sae comes through the smoke, Chung-Sook quickly snatches his wrist, pulling him into a vicious fight. Ki-Tek heaves his toy axe at Kun-Sae as he runs toward th fight. It misses Kun-Sae and instead bounces off Chung-So head. Meanwhile Dong-Ik jumps over the wounded Ki-Jung and spri toward Da-Song. He picks up the spasming child and runs b through the crowd toward Yon-Kyo.  127. Chung-Sook and Kun-Sae go at each other in the middle of garden like two predators. Ki-Tek comes to help but can’t a way to squeeze between them. He goes to Ki-Jung and tries to stanch the blood. It won’ stop. He looks for something to tie her with, but there’s nothing around. Everyone is busy fleeing, and no one stop help.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK
dialogues.text: Help! Please help us! Dong-Ik gives Da-Song to Yon-Kyo, who barks furiously at Tek.

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Mr. Kim, get the car! We can’t wait for an ambulance!

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: Kim! Get the car!

dialogues.speaker: YON-KYO
dialogues.text: Fifteen minutes! Dong-Ik and Yon-Kyo scream frantically at Ki-Tek as he desperately tries to stop the blood from Ki-Jung’s wound. Yon-Kyo has a crazed look. Her maternal instinct has been kicked up to 11. She doesn’t care that Ki-Jung is dying o that two deranged people are fighting in her garden. Dong-Ik can’t wait anymore. He yells at Ki-Tek.

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK
dialogues.text: Keys! Give me the keys! At that moment -- We see the hell breaking loose in the garden in SLOW MOTI Party Guests continue to escape one by one, and only the ‘little people’ are left viciously fighting for their liv KI-TEK’S POV -- He sees his daughter’s blood dripping between his fingers His wife flailing under a man with a knife... Dong-Ik and Kyo yelling at him... Party Guests running away... To add to the list of completely fucked-up shit, he sees Da-Hae walking toward the gate with a bloody and unconsci Ki-Woo on her back. Bawling her eyes out.  128. Meanwhile Dong-Ik continues to yell at Ki-Tek --

dialogues.speaker: DONG-IK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The keys! Ki-Tek removes the car keys from his pocket and hastily t them at Dong-Ik. They hit one of the fleeing guests and d in the grass. Kun-Sae and Chung-Sook roll over the keys as they continu their death match. Kun-Sae picks up the fallen kitchen kn and stabs Chung-Sook in the arm! Chung-Sook grabs her arm as she falls into a pile of burn logs behind her. She screams. Kun-Sae is not done. He climbs on top of her and raises t knife to finish her off. Ki-Tek jumps at Kun-Sae to stop him, but Kun-Sae is too s His rage has endowed him with supernatural strength. He quickly subdues Ki-Tek and brings the knife up to stab hi Ki-Tek closes his eyes. He braces himself for the final m when -- Nothing happens? Ki-Tek slowly opens his eyes. He sees -- A METAL BARBECUE SKEWER deeply plunged into Kun-Sae’s wai Kun-Sae can’t even scream. The pain of the hot skewer pie his innards is too much. We see Chung-Sook holding the other end. In between we se pieces of meat and sausage smoking on the skewer. As Chun Sook lets go -- Kun-Sae gradually crumbles to the ground. Ki-Tek’s crazed, red eyes see Dong-Ik running toward him. Dong-Ik lifts Chung-Sook and searches underneath for the keys. No longer the cool, poised CEO. He’s overcome with fear, panic. He rolls over Kun-Sae and finally locates th keys when -- He smells something and frowns. It’s Kun-Sae’s body odor. holds his nose at the awful smell. Ki-Tek notices. A fleeting moment, but it triggers someth inside him. Ki-Tek picks up the TOY AXE from the ground a stalks Dong-Ik. When Dong-Ik hears Ki-Tek’s footsteps and turns around --  133 129. Ki-Tek swings the axe and plants it right between Dong-Ik neck and shoulder! That’s when we realize -- it’s not a toy. It’s a REAL AXE The one the cool guy used to chop firewood for the barbec We’re not sure if Ki-Tek knew it. It doesn’t matter. All matters is that it’s stuck deeply in Dong-Ik’s neck. Yon-Kyo and the Party Guests are too stunned to scream. Blood spurts from Dong-Ik’s neck as he falls on the grass Ki-Tek stares blankly at Dong-Ik. He feels something touc foot and looks down -- It’s Da-Song’s toy axe. The real axe is still in his hand dripping with Dong-Ik’s blood. Yon-Kyo faints with Da-Song in her arms. Everyone in the garden stops and stares at Ki-Tek, the axe murderer, in h Ki-Tek wakes up from his daze and realizes what he’s done He’s horrified. He bolts for the gate. When frightened Gu jump out of his way, he realizes that he still has the bl axe. He throws it away. Ki-Tek is scared. As he runs to the gate, he sees -- -- Chung-Sook pressing down Ki-Jung’s chest while fightin through her own pain. The Foreign Chef is beside her band her arm. -- Kun-Sae, bleeding out from his punctured waist, alone neglected by the crowd. -- A FEW MEN trying to stanch Dong-Ik’s blood while calli 911. -- WOMEN helping up Yon-Kyo and Da-Song. Ki-Tek leaves the chaos behind and runs out of the gate. SIRENS grow louder in the distance, we -- FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen is pitch black. We start hearing faint sounds before slowly FADING IN on -- A MAN staring into the CAMERA. KI-WoOo (V.0.) He was the first person I saw when I woke up a month later.  134 135 130. We realize this is KI-WOO’S POV. He narrates in a calm vo The Man has a nondescript face and narrow shoulders. He i talking, but we can’t hear anything. KI-WoO (V.0.) A detective. Although he didn’t look like one. When we focus on the Man’s mouth, we can sort of read his “You have the right to remain silent...” The Man seems to be reading Ki-Woo his Miranda Rights. REVEAL -- Ki-Woo lying on the bed, his head heavily banda He flashes a languid smile, his eyes droopy. KI-WoO (V.0.) Then I saw a doctor who didn’t look like a doctor. He told me one of the side effects of brain surgery was laughing for no reason. A QUIRKY-LOOKING DOCTOR examines Ki-Woo’s pupils. Everything seems like a dream to Ki-Woo, whose left eye i slightly crossed, possibly as a result of nerve damage du surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KI-WoO (V.0.) Maybe that’s why I laughed when I heard that Ki-Jung died. They said she died from loss of blood. Ki-Woo chuckles and grabs his stomach as he pushes an IV down the hall. The GUARDS look at him strangely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KI-wWoo (V.0.) I also laughed when Mom and I received our sentences. We avoided the slew of charges they threw at us -- forgery, home invasion, voluntary manslaughter, which we argued was self defense -- and walked away with probation.  136 137 138 131. Ki-Woo can’t stop giggling as the JUDGE hands down his sentence. Chung-Sook and his LAWYER give him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chung-Sook and Ki-Woo bounce in their seats as the bus sp away from the city. They look out at the sunny view. KI-WoO (V.0.) Same when I saw Ki-Jung again for the first time since the incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Countless WHITE URNS line the shelves. We see Ki-Jung’s picture on one of them. KI-wWoo (V.0.) I laughed then too. Ki-Woo is in front of Ki-Jung’s urn. He stares at his sis brightly smiling face in the picture. He smiles back. Chung-Sook is sobbing behind him. The picture must be a few years old. Ki-Jung is brighter, happier in it. More innocent. INT. SEMI-BASEMENT - KI-JUNG’S ROOM - DAY 138 Everything is just as Ki-Jung left it. Chung-Sook is on t floor scrubbing the remaining mud stains off the furnitur The CAMERA soon leaves her and moves to the --

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Where Ki-Woo is sitting on the toilet. He’s watching a mo old news clip on his phone. A REPORTER is in the news studio talking about the Park h incident.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 1, (NEWS)
dialogues.text: The murders, which had no apparent motive and took place in a quiet, upper-class neighborhood, have confounded the police. The other suspect, an unidentified homeless male, was murdered himself at the scene, further shrouding-- Ki-Woo flips to another news clip. Another REPORTER appea  139 140 132.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 2, (NEWS)
dialogues.text: The driver, Kim, was known to have a good relationship with his employer Park, and police have yet to narrow down a concrete motive. Kim**’s whereabouts are still unclear after he was last seen fleeing the scene, and police continue searching for leads. His cell signal was last active at the crime scene--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KI-WoO (V.0.) Of course neither Mom or I have had any contact with you since that day. Ki-Woo is going around different apartments, posting promotional flyers. His new job. We see the DETECTIVE from the hospital following him from The Detective is watching Ki-Woo from a staircase when he twists his ankle and falls down the steps. Ki-Woo sees the Detective fall. He feels bad for the guy. KI-woo (V.0.) I just feel awful those poor detectives who have to follow us all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s winter now. Ki-Woo, bundled in a parka, climbs a hil the middle of Seoul, walking through gray, leafless trees breath mists in the air. KI-Woo (V.0.) I did have a strong feeling about where you might be. When he’s climbed high enough, Ki-Woo plops down on a roc removes a large TELESCOPE from his bag. KI-Woo (V.0.) So when the season changed and the news slowed down -- and when the detectives finally stopped trailing us -- I started climbing the mountain.  141 133.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the magnified view of the Park mansion and the gar KI-WoO (V.0.) You can see the house pretty well from there. Through the living room window, we see a family laughing talking. Not the Parks. A CAUCASIAN FAMILY. From the imag of the happy foreign family,

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO --
dialogues.text: Ki-Woo shivering in the cold, still looking through the telescope. It’s dark now. KI-WoO (V.0.) I don’t know why, but that day I just felt like staying longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family members have gone to their rooms to sleep, and living room is empty. There’s no movement until -- The ‘MOTION-SENSOR’ LIGHTS in the entrance start blinking blinks at varied intervals. Long then short. Short then l We see Ki-Woo’s eye grow wide through the telescope lens. He studies the timing of the blinks, which don’t seem completely random. There’s a pattern. Could it be Morse c Ki-Woo starts recording into his cell phone --

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Dash. Dot. Dash-dash-- Wind howls as Ki-Woo continues to rattle off dots and das with a trembling voice.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 141
dialogues.text: Ki-Woo is on the last train of the night, listening to th recording he made earlier through his earphones. He uses a permanent marker to transcribe the dots and das a paper prescription bag. When he runs out of room, he wr on his flyers. When he runs out of room there, he starts writing on his jeans. The WOMAN sitting next to him looks at him like he’s a cr person.  142 143 134. Ki-Woo opens a MORSE CODE CHART on his cell phone. He sto the playback. He starts deciphering the codes. Dots and dashes soon become words -- “Dear Son...”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the words turn into Ki-Tek’s VOICE-OVER --

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Dear Son. Perhaps you, if no one else, will be able to read this letter-- We see Ki-Tek sitting at a desk in the dark chamber. On t desk is a densely written letter, which he’s translating Morse code. He consults a faded MORSE CODE CHART that Kun put up above the desk.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You were a Boy Scout so I’m hoping this will somehow reach you. Ki-Tek looks thinner and has grown a full beard. He write thoughtfully one word at a time.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: How is your health? Your mother I’m not too worried about. I’m sure she’s healthy as an ox. (then) I’m doing well too. Although I cry often when I think of Ki-Jung. EXT. MANSION - GARDEN - DAY (KI-TEK’S FLASHBACK) 143 Images from the fateful day appear in flashes -- Blood spurting from Ki-Jung**’s chest... Kun-Sae’s face covered in cake and blood... The axe silently coming down Dong-Ik’s shoulder... Ki-Tek’s hand gripping the bloody a

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I still can’t believe what happened that day. It almost feels like a dream. Then we switch to Ki-Tek’s running POV**... People scream running away... The gate approaching ahead...

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I knew, as soon as I ran out of that gate, where I had to go.  144 145 146 147 135. EXT. MANSION - GATE - DAY (KI-TEK’S FLASHBACK) 144 SLOW MOTION of Ki-Tek running down the stairs in front of gate. He sees -- The front of a MINI COOPER jutting out of the half-open g They were able to squeeze the car in but not able to full close the door. Ki-Tek ducks through the opening and enters the garage. A few Party Guests roam the street in panic, but they’re stricken with terror to notice. Only the nonfunctional surveillance camera looks down at as he slips through the door. INT. MANSION - LIVING ROOM - DAY (KI-TEK’S FLASHBACK) 145 Ki-Tek pokes his head out from the garage stairs and look inside the living room. It’s empty. Through the window he sees terrified Party Guests stampeding toward the sound o ambulance. Holding his shoes in his hands, Ki-Tek quickly crosses to kitchen and rushes down to the storage basement. INT. MANSION - STORAGE BASEMENT - DAY (KI-TEK’S 146

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Even in the complete madness, I had the foresight to grab some water and food-- Ki-Tek picks up a box of CANNED TUNA and a box of EVIAN. takes care to avoid the blood and plum extract on the flo he walks across the basement. He pushes the jar cabinet to the side and opens the steel behind it. He steps inside and closes the door. As he turns the crank handle and seals himself inside the darkness -- FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we fade back in, we see an emptied-out mansion lit o moonlight. The Parks have moved out.  148 149 136.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I realized only later that a house with such a morbid history would not be appealing to potential buyers. I would have to stay in an empty house for a long time. We go from room to room until we arrive in the --

dialogues.speaker: SECRET ROOM
dialogues.text: Ki-Tek picks at a can of tuna using Kun-Sae’s fork. He ea one tiny piece at a time, conserving what limited food he All the while he stares across the room where, in the dar MUN-KWANG is curled up next to the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: One good thing about being alone was that I was finally able to give her a proper funeral. Mun-Kwang’s hefty body is thrown into a dirt hole. We see Ki-Tek panting at the mouth of the hole, exhausted moving her all the way from the basement. The hole is dug front of a large tree. One scoop at a time, dirt is scattered over Mun-Kwang’s f Ki-Tek stops shoveling and takes a break. He leans on the and looks up at the stars twinkling above.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Tree burials are all the rage these days, so I guess no one can say I didn’t give her a proper farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Tek is sitting with his eyes closed in front of Dong-I picture that Kun-Sae put up on the wall. Head bowed. Penitent. A bit comical, but he doesn’t care. He continue solemnly pay his respects when -- He hears a faint sound coming from above. He walks up the stairs and puts his ear on the steel door.  150 137. He hears lively chatter on the other side. Someone’s come see the house. They speak German.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The real estate agents were smarter than I thought. They somehow managed to sell the house to a family that just moved to Korea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s dark, and everyone is still asleep. Except Ki-Taek, walks up to the kitchen and quietly crawls over to the refrigerator. He sees a FAMILY PORTRAIT hanging on the kitchen wall. A GERMAN FAMILY OF FOUR, white teeth shining brightly throu their broad smiles. There are more pictures on the refrigerator. One picture shows a FILIPINO MAID with her around the family’s kids.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The parents both work, and the kids are at school most of the day, which should have made them ideal housemates for me. But unfortunately they have a live-in maid, and I risk my life every night for the tiny window of opportunity I have to venture outside. Ki-Tek carefully opens the fridge, and a cool shaft of li hits his face. Inside we see -- Tofu, sausage, Korean gochujang paste, Japanese natto bea

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Luckily, Germans don’t only eat German food. I thought I would have to eat sausage and beer for the rest of my life. Ki-Tek takes a little of each food and puts them in Kun-S old plastic container when, through his peripheral vision sees -- Something moving in the garden! Ki-Tek nearly jumps out of his skin. He quickly turns onl realize --  151 152 153 138. It was his own reflection in the living room window. He s at the pale ghost for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Ki-Tek eats tofu in the dark corner. Above the long be we see his dull, soulless eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: When you're in here, you lose your sense of reality. -- Ki-Tek lies motionless on Kun-Sae’s cot. His breathing so faint that we almost can’t tell he’s alive.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But today was a good day. I wrote this letter to you. -- Ki-Tek gets up and walks over to the light switches. Looking at his Morse-code-coverted letter, he starts turn the switches on and off. As he sends his coded message to outside world, we very slowly -- FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: KI-TEK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Take care, Son. EXT. KI-WOO’S NEIGHBORHOOD - ALLEY - EARLY MORNING 152 Ki-Woo runs as fast as he can through the alley, chest bu with excitement. His breath creates a trail of mist as he passes the lights of nearby semi-basement apartments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An out-of-breath Ki-Woo runs into the apartment and immed picks up a used piece of paper. He doesn’t even bother to his coat off. He sits at the kitchen table and starts writing furiously As CAMERA TRACKS IN on his quickly moving hand -- Begin SENTIMENTAL MUSIC.  154 155 156 157 158 139.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We MOVE IN on Ki-Woo’s sleeping face. He looks happy. Tig held in his hand is the letter he just wrote. His eyelids flutter lightly. He must be dreaming. We hear KI-WOO’S VOICE reading the letter -- KI-wWoO (V.0.) Father. Today I made a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We witness the moment when the VIEWING STONE was first discovered. A PAIR OF HANDS pick up the rock from a beaut pristine stream. KI-Woo (V.0.) A long-term plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Woo walks up the hill of the wealthy neighborhood. He’ older. Dressed in a nice suit and tie. KI-WoO (V.0.) I’m going to make a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ki-Woo is at the mansion. The one that at different point belonged to the Parks, the German family, and Namgoong Hy He walks up to the gate with a few REAL ESTATE AGENTS. KI-WoO (V.0.) First I’1l need to go to college. Then I’1l get a job and get married. But ultimately, I want to get rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A FEMALE REAL ESTATE AGENT shows Ki-Woo the garden. Ki stands in the sunlight and looks up at the majestic trees KI-WoO (V.0.) And when I get rich, I will buy this house.  159 140. -- As PROFESSIONAL MOVERS carry boxes into the house, two people step into the living room -- Ki-Woo and Chung-Sook. Outside the window, we see a WOMAN and a GIRL -- Ki-Woo’s and daughter? -- playing in the garden. KI-wWoO (V.0.) We'll pick a sunny day to move in. -- Everything has been unpacked and put in place. The Mov leave, and only Ki-Woo and his family remain. They are enjoying the sun at the patio table. Ki-Woo turn toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then all you have to do is walk up the stairs. He’s looking at the kitchen. Late afternoon rays lean int at a low angle. We hear FOOTSTEPS coming from the basemen stairs. CAMERA MOVES IN, and we see a faint glimpse of someone co up the stairs. Ki-Tek?

dialogues.speaker: KI-WOO
dialogues.text: Come out, Dad. Then at last -- Ki-Tek walks out into the bright garden. Buckets of sunli wash away years of darkness. He hugs his family. An emoti reunion. As SENTIMENTAL MUSIC swells into a climax --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold. Windy. The sun is dropping fast. Ki-Woo is on the mountain again looking through the telescope. He puts it down and looks into the distance. KI-WoOo (V.0.) But I have a problem, Father -- I have no idea how to get this letter to you.  141. We see the Park mansion far away. Surrounded by countless other mansions. Lights turn on and off across the neighborhood. It’s as if the houses are trying to talk to Ki-Woo’s nose is bright red from the cold. His eyes brim tears. Sharp wind cuts up his breath as soon as it mists in the As the wind continues to howl -- FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: OVER BLACK --
dialogues.text: MUSIC plays. Bright, but with an undertone of hopelessnes The End  NEONratedAwards.com
